llm_recommendations.reason_for_recommendation: Shares surge 4% after Q3 net jumps 17%; steady profit growth driven by stable input costs and consistent demand. Nomura reiterates Buy rating with target price of Rs 7,000.
Shares rose by 4% after Q3FY26 results announcement; steady profit growth due to stable input costs and consistent demand for biscuits. Nomura has a Buy rating with a target price of Rs 7,000.
Government plans to sell 5% stake through an OFS (potential selling pressure). Q3FY26 results show a 190% jump in net profit and 16.4% increase in revenue (positive earnings).

Q3 FY26 results showed a 61% rise in net profit and 40% growth in revenue, leading to a 52-week high in its shares. Jewellery business remained strong. JM Financial has recommended a 'Buy' with a potential upside of 97%.
Q3 profit falls 34% due to a drop in crude oil prices, revenue also decreased by 6.2%. Declared an interim dividend of ₹7 per share. Refining arm, Numaligarh Refinery Limited, saw a surge in profit.
Investing Rs 4,500 crore in India's smart meter market, plans to double production capacity and enter the battery energy storage business. Considering an IPO.
Plans to cautiously expand its unsecured loan portfolio, expects Net Interest Margin (NIM) to be at 3.90% by 2026-27, aims for loan growth of 16-17% and deposit growth of 13%.

Reported a 19.56% decrease in net profit due to a one-time charge from new Labour Codes (negative), but revenue increased by 10.69% and Ebit up by 11.2% (positive). Announced a new strategic initiative, 'AI First'.
Surpassed Reliance Jio in net subscriber additions in December 2025 (5.43 million compared to Jio's 2.96 million). Also outpaced Jio in 5G FWA customer additions.
Reliance Jio (a division of Reliance Industries) had lower net subscriber additions than Bharti Airtel in December 2025 and was outpaced in 5G FWA customer additions.
Saw a decrease in subscriber loss, indicating an improving trend.
IndiGo (airline brand) assures stable operations as relaxations from Flight Duty Time Limitation (FDTL) norms end, following disruptions in December due to crew shortages.
Mass-market brand, Skybags, has joined forces with Chennai Super Kings (CSK) to enter the sports category, becoming the Official Luggage Partner for the IPL 2026 season.
Share price plunged 5.4% after the government decided to pare 5% stake in the PSU via an Offer for Sale (OFS) with a floor price of Rs 254 per equity share.
Upcoming announcement of Q3 FY26 results. Board of Directors to meet on Feb. 12 to consider and approve financial results.
Led Sensex gainers, rising 2.03% as investor sentiment improved.
Gained 1.42% amidst improved investor sentiment, extending gains for the third day (likely influenced by strong Q3 results mentioned elsewhere).
Up 1.04% as investor sentiment improved.
Added 0.41% as investor sentiment improved.
Opened higher, rising 0.26% as investor sentiment improved.
Saw the sharpest fall, slipping 1.20% amidst market movements.
Declined 0.91% amidst market movements.
Down 0.88% amidst market movements.
Fell 0.59% amidst market movements.
Eased 0.57% amidst market movements.
